Class LoginBoundary

java.lang.Object
boundary.BaseBoundary
boundary.LoginBoundary
public class LoginBoundary extends BaseBoundary
Console boundary class handling interactive login flow for all user roles in the Internship Placement Management System. This class manages user authentication through the AuthController and creates session objects for authenticated users. Supports login flows for Students, Company Representatives, and Career Center Staff with role-specific validation and approval checks.

The login boundary provides:

  • Interactive credential prompting with validation
  • Multiple login attempt handling
  • Role-based session creation
  • Company representative approval status checking
  • Login help information
  • Graceful exit and retry mechanisms

  • Constructor Details

    • LoginBoundary

      public LoginBoundary(StudentRepository students, CompanyRepRepository reps, CareerCenterStaffRepository staff, AuthController auth)
      Constructs a LoginBoundary with access to all user repositories and authentication services. Initializes the boundary with repositories for all user types to enable user lookup and session creation.
      Parameters:
      students - repository of student users for student session creation
      reps - repository of company representatives for company rep session creation
      staff - repository of career center staff for staff session creation
      auth - authentication controller for credential validation and token generation
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any repository or auth controller is null

  • Method Details

    • performLogin

      public Optional<LoginBoundary.Session> performLogin()
      Performs the interactive login flow with credential prompts and validation. This method guides users through the authentication process with multiple attempts and returns a Session object on successful authentication.

      Login Flow:

      1. Prompts for user ID/email with exit option
      2. Validates input format and emptiness
      3. Prompts for password
      4. Delegates authentication to AuthController
      5. Creates session on successful authentication
      6. Offers retry option on failure
      Returns:
      Optional containing a LoginBoundary.Session on successful authentication, or Optional.empty() if login failed, was cancelled, or user lacks approval
      Throws:
      SecurityException - if authentication service is unavailable
      See Also:
      • createSessionFromAuthToken(String, String)
      • promptRetry()

    • login

      public Optional<LoginBoundary.Session> login(String userInput)
      Alternative login entry point for programmatic or backward compatibility use. Accepts pre-provided user input instead of prompting, useful for testing or integration with other systems.
      Parameters:
      userInput - student ID, company representative email, or staff ID
      Returns:
      Optional containing a LoginBoundary.Session on successful authentication, or Optional.empty() if login failed
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if userInput is null or empty
      See Also:
      • performLogin()

    • displayLoginHelp

      public void displayLoginHelp()
      Displays comprehensive login help information for all user roles. Provides format specifications for login credentials and default passwords to assist users with authentication.

      Help information includes:

      • Student login format and default password
      • Company representative requirements and approval process
      • Staff login format and default password
